Title: Stop using Code Coverage as a Quality metric
Description: ‚ÄúWhen a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure‚Äù - Goodhart's Law Code coverage serves as a valuable metric for gauging the extent of code covered by test cases. However, using it as the metric to determine code quality is misplaced.

Title: Episode 64: GitKraken - with Justin Roberts and Eric Amodio
Description:
In this episode, I was joined by Justin Roberts and Eric Amodio to chat about the GitKraken Git client. We chatted about its features, and also what it‚Äôs been like working on it. We also spoke about the GitLens VS Code client.
Justin is the Senior Director of Product at GitKraken, and has been leading the design of the GitKraken Git Client. Eric is the CTO, and also the creator of GitLens for VS Code, and previously a VS Code developer at Microsoft.

Title: S06E09 - From Code Generation to Revolutionary RavenDB: Unveiling the Database Secrets with Oren Eini
Description: Seasoned developer Oren Eini discusses the complexities and advancements of working with the .NET framework and databases like RavenDB. From the evolution of the language to the challenges of working with generated code, Eini provides valuable insights into the ever-changing world of software development. With a serious and insightful tone, this episode of The Modern .NET Show podcast is a must-listen for developers looking to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field.

Title: The ZK update conflict issue in multi-user applications
Description:
I haven't seen much ink being spewed on the ZK update conflict issue so I'll write a short note here.
Let's take a step back. Zero-knowledge proofs allow you to prove the result of the execution of some logic. Like signatures attached to data you receive, ZK proofs can be attached to a computation result. This means that with ZK, internet protocols can be rethought and redesigned. If execution of  ...

Title: Memory Safe C Compiler
